text:
If I run junit tests with <junit fork="yes" forkmode="once"/> and include a
formatter like: <formatter
classname="com.xhive.testframework.XhiveTestResultsFormatter" extension=".xml"
/> then the generated files don't get the proper extension, but rather an
appended "null". E.g. instead of
> TEST-com.xhive.xquerytests.FullTextIndexTest.xml
I get 
> TEST-com.xhive.xquerytests.FullTextIndexTestnull
creator: martin@x-hive.com

text:
I tested this some more and now I'm really confused. This seems to be fixed in
ANT 1.6.5 as it does not happen when I download the sourceball and compile it
myself.

However both the Ubuntu Ant distribution and (apparently) the Eclipse one, both
in version 1.6.5, expose that certain error.

Precisely when forking the target is called with:
    [junit]
'formatter=com.xhive.testframework.XhiveTestResultsFormatter,/home/martin/vanilla_xhive/build/testresults/xml/null.xml'
where the null in "null.xml" should be IGNORETHIS, and indeed is in my
self-compiled 1.6.5 version.

This then leads to the problem, as far as I can judge from the sourcecode.

I'm not quite sure what to do with this, is this a Ubuntu/Eclipse bug?
creator: martin@x-hive.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
This is fixed in 1.6.3, no idea what the Linux distros declare as 1.6.5.
